p: While most of the parameters are based directly on data, we adjusted the maximum probability of infection (default 0.0025), mean degree (default 0.75), and the male- and female-specific concurrency parameters (defaults 0.25 and 0.04) to give prevalence and incidence values and male-to-female infection ratios that fall within ranges seen in sub-Saharan epidemics. [ 1, 2, 26, 44].
